definition-item.definition-title: PRODUCING, WORKING OR HANDLING ICE

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Frozen sweets, including ice-cream, their production

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Concentrating solutions by removing frozen solvents
Purification of water by freezing
Refrigeration machines, plants, or systems
Refrigerators; cold rooms; ice-boxes; cooling or freezing apparatus
Solidification of gases or gaseous mixtures
Freeze-drying

section-body.paragraph-text: Control means for production, working, storing or distribution of ice are classified in F25C2600/00.
Sensors for production, working, storing or distribution of ice are classified in F25C2700/00.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ice
Any frozen liquid and also covers frozen semi-liquids or pasty substances

definition-item.definition-title: Producing ice (F25C3/00 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Freezers for pelletizing/granulating liquids.
Production of ice slurries.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Methods or apparatus specially adapted for producing ice or snow for winter sports or similar recreational purposes, e.g. for sporting installations; Producing artificial snow

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Production of bar-ice.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: by immersing freezing chambers {, cylindrical bodies} or plates into water

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Producing ice by immersing cooling fingers, rods, conduits, pipes, chambers or plates into water.

In this subgroup multiple classification in F25B21/02 for cooling the cold finger with a Peltier device is used.
In this subgroup multiple classification in F25B39/02 for cooling the cold finger with refrigerant evaporating in an evaporator.

definition-item.definition-title: by freezing water on cooled surfaces, e.g. to form slabs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Producing ice by freezing water on cooled surfaces.
Ice slabs.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {on flexible surfaces}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Producing ice by freezing water on flexible surfaces.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: to form thin sheets which are removed by scraping or wedging, e.g. in the form of flakes

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Producing ice by freezing water on cooled flat surfaces to form thin sheets which are removed by scraping or wedging, e.g. in the form of flakes.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: from the outer walls of cooled bodies

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Producing ice by freezing water on cooled surfaces to form thin sheets which are removed by scraping or wedging from the outer walls of cooled bodies.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: from the inner walls of cooled bodies

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Producing ice by freezing water on cooled surfaces to form thin sheets which are removed by scraping or wedging from the inner walls of cooled bodies.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: by using augers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Producing ice by freezing water to form thin sheets which are removed from the inner walls of cooled bodies by using augers.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.
